intro: Hildegardia erythrosiphon var. alluaudiana, commonly known as the red-flowered hildegardia, is a striking plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range from red to orange in color. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with rough, hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts for its vibrant display.
